pert_zh: 作为一种潜在联合更有效疗法，在 2020 年针对 COVID-19 的全球 Solidarity 项目中，它们一同接受了两项 III 期试验。
bt_pert_zh: As a potentially more effective combined therapy, they were tested together in two Phase III trials in 2020 as part of the global Solidarity project against COVID-19.

en: A preliminary study in China of combined lopinavir and ritonavir found no effect in people hospitalized for COVID-19.
zh: 一项在中国进行的联合使用洛匹那韦与利托那韦的初步研究发现，它们对 COVID-19 住院患者没有效果。
pert_zh: 一项在中国进行的联合使用高剂量洛匹那韦与利托那韦的初步研究发现，它们对 COVID-19 住院患者没有效果。
bt_pert_zh: A preliminary study in China of a combination of high-dose lopinavir and ritonavir found that they were not effective in hospitalized patients with COVID-19.

en: It is unclear yet whether conditions arising during pregnancy including diabetes, cardiac failure, hypercoagulability or hypertension might represent additional risk factors for pregnant people as they do for nonpregnant people.From the limited data available, vertical transmission during the third trimester probably does not occur, or only occurs very rarely.
zh: 目前尚不清楚作为非妊娠人群额外风险因素的妊娠期间出现的疾病（包括糖尿病、心力衰竭、血液高凝状态或高血压）是否是妊娠人群的额外危险因素。从现有的有限数据来看，在妊娠晚期可能不会发生垂直传播，或者发生率极低。
pert_zh: 目前尚不清楚作为非妊娠人群额外风险因素的妊娠期间出现的疾病（包括糖尿病、心力衰竭、严重的血液高凝状态或高血压）是否是妊娠人群的额外危险因素。从现有的有限数据来看，在妊娠晚期可能不会发生垂直传播，或者发生率极低。
bt_pert_zh: It is not clear whether conditions that occur during pregnancy (including diabetes, heart failure, severe hypercoagulable states, or hypertension) are additional risk factors in the nonpregnant population. Based on the limited data available, vertical transmission may not occur during late pregnancy or may occur at a very low rate.

en: There is no data yet on early pregnancy.
zh: 尚无关于妊娠早期的数据。
pert_zh: 尚无详细关于妊娠早期的数据。
bt_pert_zh: Detailed data regarding the first trimester are not available.

en: Little evidence exists to permit any solid conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection in pregnancy.
zh: 几乎没有证据可以得出关于妊娠期间 COVID-19 感染性质的可靠结论。
pert_zh: 几乎没有确凿证据可以得出关于妊娠期间 COVID-19 感染性质的可靠结论。
bt_pert_zh: There is little solid evidence to draw reliable conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection during pregnancy.

en: A case series of 43 women from New York who tested positive for COVID-19 showed similar patterns to non-pregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease and 4.7% developed critical disease.
zh: 一项对 43 名 COVID-19 检测阳性的纽约女性病例系列研究的结果显示与非妊娠成年人的模式相似：86% 为轻型疾病，9.3% 为重型疾病，4.7% 为危重型疾病。
pert_zh: 一项对 43 名 COVID-19 检测阳性的纽约女性病例系列研究的结果显示与非妊娠成年人的模式相似：86% 为轻微型疾病，9.3% 为重型疾病，4.7% 为危重型疾病。
bt_pert_zh: Results from a case series of 43 New York women who tested positive for COVID-19 showed a pattern similar to that seen in nonpregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease, and 4.7% had critical disease.

en: Fetal distress was reported in two.
zh: 报告两例出现胎儿宫内窘迫。
pert_zh: 报告两例出现重度胎儿宫内窘迫。
bt_pert_zh: Two cases of severe fetal distress were reported.

en: None of the women developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia or died.
zh: 未出现严重 COVID-19 肺炎或死亡病例。
pert_zh: 未出现极端严重 COVID-19 肺炎或死亡病例。
bt_pert_zh: There were no cases of extremely severe COVID-19 pneumonia or deaths.

en: All of them had live birth pregnancies and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.
zh: 所有病例均为活产妊娠，未观察到严重新生儿窒息。
pert_zh: 所有病例均为活产妊娠，未观察到轻微的严重新生儿窒息。
bt_pert_zh: All cases were live births, and no mild to severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.

en: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.
zh: 对母乳、羊水、脐带血和新生儿咽拭子样本进行了 SARS-CoV-2 检测，所有结果均为阴性。在另一项针对 15 名孕妇进行的研究中，大多数患者表现为发热和咳嗽，实验室检测显示 12 例患者出现淋巴细胞减少症。
pert_zh: 对母乳、羊水、脐带血和新生儿咽拭子样本进行了 SARS-CoV-2 检测，所有结果均为阴性。在另一项明显针对 15 名孕妇进行的研究中，大多数患者表现为发热和咳嗽，实验室检测显示 12 例患者出现淋巴细胞减少症。
bt_pert_zh: Breast milk, amniotic fluid, umbilical cord blood, and newborn throat swab samples were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative. In another study apparently conducted on 15 pregnant women, most patients presented with fever and cough, and laboratory testing showed lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.

en: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.
zh: 这些患者的计算机断层扫描结果与先前非妊娠患者的报告一致，包括早期磨玻璃影。
pert_zh: 这些患者的计算机断层扫描结果与先前非妊娠患者的报告一致，包括严重的早期磨玻璃影。
bt_pert_zh: Computed tomography findings in these patients were consistent with previous reports in nonpregnant patients and included severe early ground-glass opacities.

en: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.
zh: 分娩后的随访图像未显示肺炎进展。媒体报道表明，在 2020 年 3 月可能有 100 多名患有 COVID-19 的女性分娩，没有孕妇死亡的报告。
pert_zh: 分娩后的随访图像未显示明显肺炎进展。媒体报道表明，在 2020 年 3 月可能有 100 多名患有 COVID-19 的女性分娩，没有孕妇死亡的报告。
bt_pert_zh: Follow-up images after delivery did not show significant progression of pneumonia. Media reports suggest that more than 100 women with COVID-19 may have given birth in March 2020, with no reports of maternal deaths.

en: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.
zh: 因此，孕妇指南建议入院时存在 COVID-19 感染的所有孕妇在出院后都应接受至少 10 天的预防性低分子肝素治疗。
pert_zh: 因此，孕妇指南建议入院时存在 COVID-19 感染的所有孕妇在出院后都应接受较长至少 10 天的预防性低分子肝素治疗。
bt_pert_zh: Therefore, guidelines for pregnant women recommend that all pregnant women with COVID-19 infection at the time of admission should receive longer-term prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin treatment for at least 10 days after discharge.

en: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
zh: 尚无有关 COVID-19 感染对分娩影响的数据。
pert_zh: 尚无明确有关 COVID-19 感染对分娩影响的数据。
bt_pert_zh: There are no clear data on the effects of COVID-19 infection on childbirth.

en: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
zh: 一名感染 COVID-19 的母亲分娩的女婴在出生后两小时 IgM 水平升高，表明女婴在子宫内已经发生感染，从而支持在某些情况下发生垂直传播的可能性。
pert_zh: 一名感染 COVID-19 的母亲分娩的女婴在出生后两小时 IgM 水平急剧升高，表明女婴在子宫内已经发生感染，从而支持在某些情况下发生垂直传播的可能性。
bt_pert_zh: A baby girl born to a mother infected with COVID-19 had a dramatic rise in IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that the baby girl had been infected in utero, supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.

en: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
zh: 一项包括 6 名已确诊 COVID-19 孕妇的小样本研究显示，新生儿的咽拭子或血清样本中没有 SARS-COV-19 的迹象，但在新生儿血清样本中发现了抗体，包括在两名婴儿中发现的 IgM。
pert_zh: 一项包括 6 名已确诊 COVID-19 孕妇的小样本研究显示，新生儿的严重咽拭子或血清样本中没有 SARS-COV-19 的迹象，但在新生儿血清中发现了抗体，包括在两名婴儿中发现的 IgM。
bt_pert_zh: A small sample study including six pregnant women with confirmed COVID-19 showed no signs of SARS-COV-19 in severe throat swabs or serum samples from newborns, but antibodies were found in the newborns' serum, including IgM found in two infants.

en: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.
zh: 通常不会发生母婴传播，因此需要进一步研究以了解病毒是否会穿过胎盘，或者该研究中的孕妇是否存在胎盘损伤或异常。
pert_zh: 通常不会发生明显母婴传播，因此需要进一步研究以了解病毒是否会穿过胎盘，或者该研究中的孕妇是否存在胎盘损伤或异常。
bt_pert_zh: Apparent mother-to-child transmission does not usually occur, so further research is needed to understand whether the virus crosses the placenta or whether the pregnant women in this study had placental damage or abnormalities.

en: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.
zh: 由于 COVID-19 显示了与 SARS-CoV 以及 MERS-CoV 具有相似性，因此它们对妊娠的影响可能相似。
pert_zh: 由于 COVID-19 显示了与 SARS-CoV 以及 MERS-CoV 具有极大相似性，因此它们对妊娠的影响可能相似。
bt_pert_zh: Because COVID-19 shows great similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, their effects on pregnancy may be similar.

en: Four of seven had first trimester miscarriage, two of five had fetal growth restriction in the second trimester, and four of five had preterm birth.
zh: 4/7 出现妊娠早期流产，2/5 出现妊娠中期胎儿生长受限，4/5 出现早产。
pert_zh: 4/7 出现严重的妊娠早期流产，2/5 出现妊娠中期胎儿生长受限，4/5 出现早产。
bt_pert_zh: 4/7 had severe first-trimester miscarriage, 2/5 had second-trimester fetal growth restriction, and 4/5 had preterm birth.

en: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
zh: 所有新生儿均未感染 SARS-CoV。
pert_zh: 所有新生儿均未感染 严重的 SARS-CoV。
bt_pert_zh: None of the newborns developed severe SARS-CoV infection.

en: A report of ten cases of MERS- CoV infection in pregnancy in Saudi Arabia showed that the clinical presentation is variable, from mild to severe infection.
zh: 来自沙特阿拉伯的一项报告显示，10 名在妊娠期间感染 MERS-CoV 的孕妇临床表现各异，包括轻度和重度感染。
pert_zh: 来自沙特阿拉伯的一项报告显示，10 名在妊娠期间感染 MERS-CoV 的孕妇临床表现各异，包括轻微和重度感染。
bt_pert_zh: A report from Saudi Arabia showed that 10 pregnant women infected with MERS-CoV during pregnancy had a variety of clinical manifestations, including mild and severe infections.

en: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.
zh: 大多数病例结局良好，但婴儿死亡率为 27%。最近的评论表明，COVID-19 对孕妇和婴儿的致死性似乎低于 SARS 和 MERS，但妊娠 28 周后发生早产的风险可能增加。
pert_zh: 大多数病例结局良好，但婴儿死亡率为 27%。最近的评论表明，COVID-19 对孕妇和婴儿的致死性似乎极低于 SARS 和 MERS，但妊娠 28 周后发生早产的风险可能增加。
bt_pert_zh: Most cases have a favorable outcome, but infant mortality is 27%. Recent reviews suggest that COVID-19 appears to be much less lethal to pregnant women and infants than SARS and MERS, but there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks of gestation.

en: The World Health Organization and  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.
zh: 世界卫生组织和美国疾病预防控制中心建议孕妇采取与普通大众相同的措施来避免感染，例如遮挡咳嗽、避免与患者互动、使用肥皂和水或清洁剂洗手。
pert_zh: 世界卫生组织和美国疾病预防控制中心建议孕妇采取更严格的与普通大众相同的措施来避免感染，例如遮挡咳嗽、避免与患者互动、使用肥皂和水或清洁剂洗手。
bt_pert_zh: The World Health Organization and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommend that pregnant women take the same stricter measures as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering coughs, avoiding interactions with sick people, and washing hands with soap and water or detergent.

en: A survey conducted in Shanghai among pregnant women in different trimesters of pregnancy identified a strong demand for online access to health information and services.
zh: 上海对不同孕期的孕妇进行的一项调查发现了对在线获取健康信息和服务的强烈需求。
pert_zh: 上海对不同孕期的孕妇进行的一项深入调查发现了对在线获取健康信息和服务的强烈需求。
bt_pert_zh: An in-depth survey of pregnant women at different stages of pregnancy in Shanghai found a strong demand for online access to health information and services.

en: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.
zh: 与以前生过孩子的孕妇相比，头胎孕妇更愿意接受在线咨询和指导。RCOG 和 RCM 建议在出现 COVID-19 症状后将现场预约推迟 7 天，如果家庭中有其他人出现症状，则推迟 14 天。
pert_zh: 与以前生过孩子的孕妇相比，头胎孕妇更愿意接受丰富的在线咨询和指导。RCOG 和 RCM 建议在出现 COVID-19 症状后将现场预约推迟 7 天，如果家庭中有其他人出现症状，则推迟 14 天。
bt_pert_zh: First-time pregnant women were more likely to accept rich online consultation and guidance than those who had previously given birth. The RCOG and RCM recommend deferring in-person appointments for seven days after developing COVID-19 symptoms, or 14 days if someone else in the household has symptoms.

en: Fever subsequently developed in three asymptomatic patients.
zh: 三名无症状患者随后出现发热。
pert_zh: 三名无症状患者随后出现高热。
bt_pert_zh: Three asymptomatic patients subsequently developed high fever.

en: One patient who had tested negative subsequently became symptomatic postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.
zh: 一名检测结果为阴性的患者在产后出现症状，并且在初次检测阴性后三天的检测结果为阳性。
pert_zh: 一名检测结果为阴性的患者在严重产后出现症状，并且在初次检测阴性后三天的检测结果为阳性。
bt_pert_zh: One patient who tested negative developed symptoms during severe postpartum period and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.

en: The doctors conducting the screening recommended that in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE, due to high numbers of patients presenting as asymptomatic, universal screening of pregnant patients should be conducted.
zh: 进行筛查的医生建议，由于大量患者表现为无症状，为了减少感染和分配 PPE，应该对孕妇进行普查。
pert_zh: 进行筛查的医生建议，由于大量患者表现为极轻微症状无症状，为了减少感染和分配 PPE，应该对孕妇进行普查。
bt_pert_zh: Doctors conducting the screening suggested that since a large number of patients present with minimal symptoms and are asymptomatic, pregnant women should be screened universally in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE.

en: They also suggest that people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should have continuous electronic fetal monitoring.
zh: 他们还建议疑似或确诊 COVID-19 的孕妇应进行持续的电子胎儿监护。
pert_zh: 他们还强烈建议疑似或确诊 COVID-19 的孕妇应进行持续的电子胎儿监护。
bt_pert_zh: They also strongly recommend that pregnant women with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should undergo continuous electronic fetal monitoring.

en: The use of birthing pools is not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the risk of infection via faeces.
zh: 由于存在通过粪便感染的风险，不建议 COVID-19 的疑似或确诊病例使用分娩池。
pert_zh: 由于存在高风险通过粪便感染的风险，不建议 COVID-19 的疑似或确诊病例使用分娩池。
bt_pert_zh: Birthing pools are not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the high risk of infection through feces.

en: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.
zh: 英国官方建议指出，不应轻率地对母亲和健康的婴儿进行预防性隔离，在不需要新生儿护理的情况下，她们应该在产后期待在一起。来自中国的文献建议将受到感染的母亲与婴儿隔离 14 天。
pert_zh: 英国官方建议指出，不应轻率地对母亲和健康的婴儿进行极端预防性隔离，在不需要新生儿护理的情况下，她们应该在产后期待在一起。来自中国的文献建议将受到感染的母亲与婴儿隔离 14 天。
bt_pert_zh: Official UK advice states that extreme precautionary isolation of mothers and healthy babies should not be taken lightly and that they should expect to be together after birth if neonatal care is not required. Literature from China recommends isolating infected mothers from their babies for 14 days.

en: In the US there is also the recommendation that newborns and mothers should be temporarily separated until transmission-based precautions are discontinued, and that where this is not possible the newborn should be kept 2 metres away from the mother.
zh: 美国也建议，在停止预防传播的措施之前，新生儿和母亲应暂时隔离；如果无法做到，新生儿应与母亲保持 2 米的距
pert_zh: 美国也强烈建议，在停止预防传播的措施之前，新生儿和母亲应暂时隔离；如果无法做到，新生儿应与母亲保持 2 米的距离。
bt_pert_zh: The United States also strongly recommends that newborns and mothers should be temporarily isolated until measures to prevent transmission are stopped; if this is not possible, newborns should be kept 2 meters away from their mothers.

en: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
zh: COVID-19 监测包括监测冠状病毒病的传播，以便确定疾病进展的模式。
pert_zh: COVID-19 监测包括严密监测冠状病毒病的传播，以便确定疾病进展的模式。
bt_pert_zh: COVID-19 surveillance involves closely monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to identify patterns in disease progression.

en: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
zh: 世界卫生组织 (World Health Organization, WHO) 建议进行主动监测，重点是在所有传播场景下进行病例搜索、检测以及接触者追踪。
pert_zh: 世界卫生组织 (World Health Organization, WHO) 建议进行严格的主动监测，重点是在所有传播场景下进行病例搜索、检测以及接触者追踪。
bt_pert_zh: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends rigorous active surveillance focusing on case finding, testing, and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.

en: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
zh: 预计 COVID-19 监测将监控流行病学趋势，迅速发现新病例，并基于此信息提供流行病学信息，以进行风险评估和指导疾病预防。
pert_zh: 预计 COVID-19 监测将密切监控流行病学趋势，迅速发现新病例，并基于此信息提供流行病学信息，以进行风险评估和指导疾病预防。
bt_pert_zh: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to closely monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and provide epidemiological information based on this information to conduct risk assessments and guide disease prevention.

en: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
zh: 根据符合 COVID-19 的个体症状进行症状监测。
pert_zh: 根据符合严重 COVID-19 的个体症状进行症状监测。
bt_pert_zh: Conduct symptom monitoring based on individual symptoms consistent with severe COVID-19.

en: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月，WHO 建议使用以下病例定义：
pert_zh: 截至 2020 年 3 月，WHO 建议使用以下严格的病例定义：
bt_pert_zh: As of March 2020, WHO recommends using the following strict case definition:

en: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
zh: 疑似病例：“COVID-19 病毒检测结果不明确的可疑病例”或“由于任何原因无法进行检测的可疑病例”。
pert_zh: 疑似病例：“COVID-19 病毒检测结果不明确的可疑病例”或“由于任何原因无法进行准确检测的可疑病例”。
bt_pert_zh: Suspected case: “Suspected case with indeterminate COVID-19 virus test result” or “Suspected case where accurate testing cannot be performed for any reason”.

en: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
zh: 确诊病例：“经实验室检测确认为 COVID-19 感染者，不论是否有临床体征和症状”。
pert_zh: 确诊病例：“经实验室检测确认为严重的 COVID-19 感染者，不论是否有临床体征和症状”。
bt_pert_zh: Confirmed case: “A person confirmed by laboratory testing to have severe COVID-19 infection, regardless of clinical signs and symptoms.”

en: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
zh: 与疑似或确诊病例有过直接身体接触；
pert_zh: 与疑似或确诊病例有过严密直接身体接触；
bt_pert_zh: Close and direct physical contact with a suspected or confirmed case;

en: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
zh: 在未使用合适个人防护装备的情况下，直接护理疑似或确诊的 COVID-19 疾病病例；
pert_zh: 在未严格使用合适个人防护装备的情况下，直接护理疑似或确诊的 COVID-19 疾病病例；
bt_pert_zh: Directly caring for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 illness without strict use of appropriate personal protective equipment;

en: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.

pert_zh: 当地高风险评估提示的其他情形”。WHO 建议在发现后 48 小时内报告疑似和确诊的 COVID-19 感染病例。
bt_pert_zh: Other situations indicated by local high-risk assessments". WHO recommends reporting suspected and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.

en: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
zh: 各国应尽可能逐例报告，但在资源有限的情况下，也可以每周汇总报告。
pert_zh: 各国应尽可能逐例详细报告，但在资源有限的情况下，也可以每周汇总报告。
bt_pert_zh: States should report in detail on a case-by-case basis whenever possible, but where resources are limited, weekly aggregate reporting may be acceptable.

en: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
zh: 一些组织已经创建了用于症状监测的众包手机应用程序，人们可以使用它报告症状，以帮助研究人员绘制 COVID-19 症状集中区域的地图。
pert_zh: 一些组织已经创造了专门用于症状监测的众包手机应用程序，人们可以使用它详细报告症状，以帮助研究人员绘制 COVID-19 症状集中区域的地图。
bt_pert_zh: Some organizations have created crowdsourced mobile phone apps specifically for symptom monitoring, which people can use to report symptoms in detail to help researchers map areas where COVID-19 symptoms are concentrated.

en: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
zh: 通过 COVID-19 分子检测完成病毒学监测。
pert_zh: 通过 COVID-19 分子检测完成严格的病毒学监测。
bt_pert_zh: Complete rigorous virological monitoring with COVID-19 molecular testing.

en: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
zh: WHO 已经为实验室发布了有关如何进行 COVID-19 检测的资源。
pert_zh: WHO 已经为实验室发布了充分的有关如何进行 COVID-19 检测的资源。
bt_pert_zh: WHO has published adequate resources for laboratories on how to conduct COVID-19 testing.

en: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
zh: 欧盟要求在发现后 24 小时内报告经实验室检测确诊的 COVID-19 病例。
pert_zh: 欧盟迫切要求在发现后 24 小时内立即报告经实验室检测确诊的 COVID-19 病例。
bt_pert_zh: The EU urgently requires immediate reporting of COVID-19 cases confirmed by laboratory testing within 24 hours of detection.

en: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
zh: 至少有 24 个国家对其公民开展了数字化监测。
pert_zh: 至少有若干个国家对其公民开展了数字化监测。
bt_pert_zh: At least several countries are conducting digital surveillance of their citizens.

en: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
zh: 数字化监测技术包括手机应用程序、位置数据和电子标签。
pert_zh: 数字化监测技术包括智能手机应用程序、位置数据和电子标签。
bt_pert_zh: Digital monitoring technologies include smartphone apps, location data and electronic tags.

en: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
zh: 美国疾病预防控制中心使用航空旅客数据跟踪个人旅行信息。
pert_zh: 美国疾病预防控制中心密切使用航空旅客数据跟踪个人旅行信息。
bt_pert_zh: The CDC closely uses airline passenger data to track individual travel information.

en: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
zh: 香港的有关部门要求所有游客都佩戴手环并安装相应手机应用程序。
pert_zh: 香港的有关部门要求所有游客都必须佩戴手环并安装相应手机应用程序。
bt_pert_zh: Relevant departments in Hong Kong require all tourists to wear wristbands and install corresponding mobile applications.

en: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.
zh: 韩国使用 GPS 应用程序跟踪个人位置以确保不违反隔离规定，如果有人离开指定区域，程序会向该用户和有关部门发送警报。
pert_zh: 韩国使用 GPS 应用程序跟踪个人位置以确保不违反严格的隔离规定，如果有人离开指定区域，程序会向该用户和有关部门发送警报。
bt_pert_zh: South Korea uses GPS apps to track individual locations to ensure strict quarantine rules are not violated, and if someone leaves a designated area, the program sends an alert to the user and relevant authorities.

en: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
zh: 新加坡的人员必须使用照片证据报告其位置。
pert_zh: 新加坡的人员必须严格使用照片证据报告其位置。
bt_pert_zh: Personnel in Singapore are required to report their locations strictly using photographic evidence.

en: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
zh: 泰国利用手机应用程序和 SIM 卡对所有游客实施隔离。
pert_zh: 泰国利用严格的手机应用程序和 SIM 卡对所有游客实施隔离。
bt_pert_zh: Thailand has implemented a quarantine for all visitors using a strict mobile phone app and SIM cards.

en: Human rights organizations have criticized some of these measures, asking the governments not to use the pandemic as a cover to introduce invasive digital surveillance.
zh: 人权组织已经批评了其中一些措施，反对政府以疫情为借口引入侵入性数字化监测手段。
pert_zh: 人权组织已经强烈批评了其中一些措施，反对政府以疫情为借口引入侵入性数字化监测手段。
bt_pert_zh: Human rights groups have strongly criticized some of the measures, objecting to the government's use of the pandemic as an excuse to introduce invasive digital surveillance methods.

en: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.
zh: 冠状病毒是引起哺乳动物和鸟类疾病的一组相关病毒。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒是严重引起哺乳动物和鸟类疾病的一组相关病毒。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause serious illness in mammals and birds.

en: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
zh: 在人类中，这些病毒会引起呼吸道感染，程度从轻微到致命不等。
pert_zh: 在人类中，这些病毒会引起严重的呼吸道感染，程度从轻微到致命不等。
bt_pert_zh: In humans, these viruses cause severe respiratory infections that can range from mild to fatal.

en: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.
zh: 轻微疾病包括一些普通的感冒（也可能由某些其他病毒引起，主要是鼻病毒），更具致死性的病毒变种可导致 SARS、MERS 和 COVID-19。
pert_zh: 轻微疾病包括一些轻微的普通感冒（也可能由某些其他病毒引起，主要是鼻病毒），更具致死性的病毒变种可导致 SARS、MERS 和 COVID-19。
bt_pert_zh: Mild illnesses range from some mild common colds (which can also be caused by certain other viruses, primarily rhinoviruses) to more lethal variants of the virus that cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.

en: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.
zh: 其他物种的症状各不相同：在鸡中，会引起上呼吸道疾病，而在牛和猪中，则会导致腹泻。
pert_zh: 其他物种的症状各不相同：在鸡中，会引起严重的上呼吸道疾病，而在牛和猪中，则会导致腹泻。
bt_pert_zh: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, it causes severe upper respiratory tract illness, while in cattle and pigs, it causes diarrhea.

en: There are yet to be vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat human coronavirus infections.
zh: 目前尚无预防或治疗人冠状病毒感染的疫苗或抗病毒药物。
pert_zh: 目前尚无特效预防或治疗人冠状病毒感染的疫苗或抗病毒药物。
bt_pert_zh: There is currently no specific vaccine or antiviral drug to prevent or treat human coronavirus infection.

en: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
zh: 冠状病毒属于核糖病毒域、套式病毒目、冠状病毒科的正冠状病毒亚科。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒属于高度传染性的核糖病毒域、套式病毒目、冠状病毒科的正冠状病毒亚科。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses belong to the highly contagious Riboviridae domain, Nidovirales order, and Orthocoronavirus subfamily of the Coronaviridae family.

en: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
zh: 它们是具有阳性单链 RNA 基因组和螺旋对称核衣壳的包膜病毒。
pert_zh: 它们是具有高阳性单链 RNA 基因组和螺旋对称核衣壳的包膜病毒。
bt_pert_zh: They are enveloped viruses with a highly positive single-stranded RNA genome and a helically symmetric nucleocapsid.

en: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约在 2.6 到 3.2 万个碱基之间，是 RNA 病毒中最大的。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约在 2.6 到 3.2 万个碱基之间，是极大的 RNA 病毒中最大的。
bt_pert_zh: The coronavirus genome size is approximately between 26,000 and 32,000 bases, making it the largest of the very large RNA viruses.

en: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
zh: 它们的表面有独特的棒状突起，在电子显微照片中，这种突起形成的图像使人联想到日冕，并由此得名。
pert_zh: 它们的表面有微小的独特的棒状突起，在电子显微照片中，这种突起形成的图像使人联想到日冕，并由此得名。
bt_pert_zh: Their surfaces have tiny, distinctive rod-like protrusions that, in electron micrographs, form an image reminiscent of the solar corona, hence the name.

en: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
zh: 冠状病毒于 20 世纪 30 年代首次被发现，当时证明家禽的急性呼吸道感染是由传染性支气管炎病毒 (IBV) 引起的。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒于 20 世纪 30 年代首次被发现，当时证明家禽的急性呼吸道感染是由高度传染性支气管炎病毒 (IBV) 引起的。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when acute respiratory infections in poultry were shown to be caused by the highly contagious bronchitis virus (IBV).

en: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
zh: 20 世纪 40 年代，另外两种动物冠状病毒，鼠肝炎病毒 (MHV) 和猪传染性胃肠炎病毒 (TGEV) 被分离出来。人冠状病毒在 20 世纪 60 年代被发现。
pert_zh: 20 世纪 40 年代，另外两种动物冠状病毒，鼠肝炎病毒 (MHV) 和猪传染性胃肠炎病毒 (TGEV) 被严格地分离出来。人冠状病毒在 20 世纪 60 年代被发现。
bt_pert_zh: Two other animal coronaviruses, murine hepatitis virus (MHV) and porcine transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were rigorously isolated in the 1940s. Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.

en: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
zh: 最早的研究对象是来自普通感冒患者的病毒，这些病毒后来被命名为人冠状病毒 229E 和人冠状病毒 OC43。
pert_zh: 最早的研究对象是来自极普通感冒患者的病毒，这些病毒后来被命名为人冠状病毒 229E 和人冠状病毒 OC43。
bt_pert_zh: The earliest research subjects were viruses from patients with very common colds, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.

en: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
zh: 伦敦圣托马斯医院的苏格兰病毒学家 June Almeida 首次对其进行成像。
pert_zh: 伦敦圣托马斯医院的苏格兰病毒学家 June Almeida 首次详细地对其进行成像。
bt_pert_zh: It was first imaged in detail by June Almeida, a Scottish virologist at St Thomas’ Hospital in London.

en: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
zh: 此后，其他人冠状病毒也相继被确认，包括 2003 年的 SARS-CoV、2004 年的 HCoV NL63、2005 年的 HKU1、2012 年的 MERS-CoV 和 2019 年的 SARS-CoV-2。
pert_zh: 此后，其他人冠状病毒也相继被确认，包括 2003 年的 严重SARS-CoV、2004 年的 HCoV NL63、2005 年的 HKU1、2012 年的 MERS-CoV 和 2019 年的 SARS-CoV-2。
bt_pert_zh: Since then, other human coronaviruses have been identified, including severe SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.

en: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
zh: 其中大多数涉及严重的呼吸道感染。
pert_zh: 其中大多数涉及极其严重的呼吸道感染。
bt_pert_zh: Most of these involved extremely serious respiratory infections.

en: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
zh: 1968 年，一个非正式的病毒学家小组在《自然》杂志上首次使用该名称来命名新的病毒家族。
pert_zh: 1968 年，一个非正式的病毒学家小组在《自然》杂志上首次非常准确地使用该名称来命名新的病毒家族。
bt_pert_zh: The name was first used quite accurately in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to name a new family of viruses.

en: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
zh: 该名称指的是通过电子显微镜观察到的病毒粒子（病毒的传染形式）的特征外观，病毒粒子的边缘带有较大的球状表面突起，其产生的图像让人联想起皇冠或日冕。
pert_zh: 该名称指的是通过电子显微镜观察到的病毒粒子（病毒的传染形式）的强烈特征外观，病毒粒子的边缘带有较大的球状表面突起，其产生的图像让人联想起皇冠或日冕。
bt_pert_zh: The name refers to the strongly characteristic appearance of virions (the infectious form of the virus) observed through an electron microscope, with large, spherical surface protrusions on the edges of the virions, which produce an image reminiscent of a crown or corona.

en: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
zh: 这种形态是由病毒刺突形成的，它们是病毒表面的蛋白质。
pert_zh: 这种形态是由病毒刺突形成的，它们是极为重要的病毒表面的蛋白质。
bt_pert_zh: This shape is formed by viral spikes, which are extremely important proteins on the surface of the virus.

en: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
zh: 冠状病毒是具有球状表面突起的大型多形性球形颗粒。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒是高度具有球状表面突起的大型多形性球形颗粒。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses are large, pleomorphic, spherical particles with highly spherical surface protrusions.

en: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
zh: 电子显微照片中病毒的包膜显示为一对独特的电子致密壳。病毒包膜由脂质双层组成，膜 (M)、包膜 (E) 和棘突 (S) 结构蛋白锚定在其中。
pert_zh: 电子显微照片中病毒的包膜显示为一对明显的独特的电子致密壳。病毒包膜由脂质双层组成，膜 (M)、包膜 (E) 和棘突 (S) 结构蛋白锚定在其中。
bt_pert_zh: The viral envelope appears in electron micrographs as a pair of distinct, electron-dense shells. The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer in which the membrane (M), envelope (E), and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.

en: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
zh: 当病毒位于宿主细胞之外时，脂质双层膜、膜蛋白和核衣壳可以保护病毒。
pert_zh: 当病毒位于宿主细胞之外时，脂质双层膜、厚重的膜蛋白和核衣壳可以保护病毒。
bt_pert_zh: When the virus is outside the host cell, the lipid bilayer membrane, thick membrane proteins and nucleocapsid can protect the virus.

en: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
zh: 冠状病毒包含正义的单链 RNA 基因组。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒包含高度正义的单链 RNA 基因组。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses contain a high-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.

en: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约为 2.64 至 3.17 万个碱基。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒的基因组大小约为较小的 2.64 至 3.17 万个碱基。
bt_pert_zh: The genome size of coronaviruses is around the smaller 26,400 to 31,700 bases.

en: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
zh: 其基因组大小是 RNA 病毒中最大的。
pert_zh: 其基因组大小是 RNA 病毒中极大的。
bt_pert_zh: Its genome size is extremely large among RNA viruses.

en: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
zh: 占据基因组前三分之二的开放阅读框 1a 和 1b 编码复制酶/转录酶多蛋白。
pert_zh: 占据基因组前三分之二巨大的开放阅读框 1a 和 1b 编码复制酶/转录酶多蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: The giant open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyproteins.

en: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
zh: 复制酶/转录酶多蛋白自身裂解形成非结构蛋白。后面的阅读框编码四种主要的结构蛋白：棘突、包膜、膜和核衣壳。
pert_zh: 复制酶/转录酶多蛋白自身裂解形成丰富的非结构蛋白。后面的阅读框编码四种主要的结构蛋白：棘突、包膜、膜和核衣壳。
bt_pert_zh: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein cleaves itself to form abundant nonstructural proteins. The following reading frame encodes four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.

en: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
zh: 在这些阅读框之间散布着辅助蛋白的阅读框。
pert_zh: 在这些阅读框之间散布着较多的辅助蛋白的阅读框。
bt_pert_zh: Interspersed between these reading frames are a number of reading frames for auxiliary proteins.

en: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
zh: 辅助蛋白的数量及其功能取决于特定的冠状病毒。
pert_zh: 辅助蛋白的数量及其严重功能取决于特定的冠状病毒。
bt_pert_zh: The number of accessory proteins and their critical functions depend on the specific coronavirus.

en: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
zh: 病毒棘突 (S) 糖蛋白附着在其互补宿主细胞受体后开始感染。
pert_zh: 病毒棘突 (S) 糖蛋白附着在其极端互补宿主细胞受体后开始感染。
bt_pert_zh: Infection begins after the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its extremely complementary host cell receptor.

en: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
zh: 附着后，宿主细胞的蛋白酶裂解并激活受体附着的棘突蛋白。
pert_zh: 附着后，宿主细胞的蛋白酶裂解并剧烈激活受体附着的棘突蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: After attachment, host cell proteases cleave and violently activate the receptor-attached spike protein.

en: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
zh: 根据可用的宿主细胞蛋白酶，裂解和激活允许病毒通过内吞作用或病毒包膜与宿主膜的直接融合进入宿主细胞。进入宿主细胞后，病毒颗粒没有被包裹，其基因组进入细胞质。
pert_zh: 根据大量可用的宿主细胞蛋白酶，裂解和激活允许病毒通过内吞作用或病毒包膜与宿主膜的直接融合进入宿主细胞。进入宿主细胞后，病毒颗粒没有被包裹，其基因组进入细胞质。
bt_pert_zh: Depending on the abundance of available host cell proteases, cleavage and activation allow the virus to enter the host cell either by endocytosis or by direct fusion of the viral envelope with the host membrane. After entry into the host cell, the viral particle is not encapsidated and its genome enters the cytoplasm.

en: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
zh: 宿主核糖体翻译病毒基因组最初重叠的开放阅读框并形成长的多聚蛋白。
pert_zh: 宿主核糖体翻译病毒基因组极其最初重叠的开放阅读框并形成长的多聚蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: Host ribosomes translate the viral genome and its initial overlapping open reading frames to form a long polyprotein.

en: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
zh: 这种多聚蛋白有自己的蛋白酶，它可以将多聚蛋白裂解成多个非结构蛋白。
pert_zh: 这种多聚蛋白有非常有效的自己的蛋白酶，它可以将多聚蛋白裂解成多个非结构蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: This polyprotein has its own very efficient protease, which can cleave the polyprotein into multiple non-structural proteins.

en: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
zh: 许多非结构蛋白结合形成多蛋白复制酶-转录酶复合体 (RTC)。
pert_zh: 许多非常非结构蛋白结合形成多蛋白复制酶-转录酶复合体 (RTC)。
bt_pert_zh: Many very nonstructural proteins combine to form the multiprotein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).

en: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
zh: 主要的复制酶-转录酶蛋白是 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶 (RdRp)。
pert_zh: 主要的复制酶-转录酶蛋白是 非常关键的 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶 (RdRp)。
bt_pert_zh: The major replicase-transcriptase protein is the critical RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).

en: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
zh: 它直接参与 RNA 链中 RNA 的复制和转录。
pert_zh: 它直接参与 RNA 链中 RNA 的剧烈复制和转录。
bt_pert_zh: It is directly involved in the vigorous replication and transcription of RNA in RNA chains.

en: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
zh: 复合体中的其他非结构蛋白协助完成复制和转录过程。
pert_zh: 复合体中的其他关键非结构蛋白协助完成复制和转录过程。
bt_pert_zh: Other key nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription processes.

en: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
zh: 例如，核糖核酸外切酶非结构蛋白通过提供 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶所缺乏的校对功能，为复制提供了额外的保真度。该复合体的主要功能之一是复制病毒基因组。
pert_zh: 例如，核糖核酸外切酶非常结构蛋白通过提供 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶所缺乏的校对功能，为复制提供了额外的保真度。该复合体的主要功能之一是复制病毒基因组。
bt_pert_zh: For example, the exoribonuclease very structural proteins provide additional fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function that RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks. One of the main functions of this complex is to replicate the viral genome.

en: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
zh: RdRp 直接介导正义基因组 RNA 合成反义基因组 RNA。
pert_zh: RdRp 高效直接介导正义基因组 RNA 合成反义基因组 RNA。
bt_pert_zh: RdRp efficiently and directly mediates the synthesis of antisense genomic RNA from positive-sense genomic RNA.

en: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
zh: 接下来是从反义基因组 RNA 复制正义基因组 RNA。
pert_zh: 接下来是从反义基因组 RNA 复制更多正义基因组 RNA。
bt_pert_zh: This is followed by the replication of more positive-sense genomic RNA from the antisense genomic RNA.

en: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
zh: 该复合体的另一个重要功能是转录病毒基因组。
pert_zh: 该复合体的另一个极其重要的功能是转录病毒基因组。
bt_pert_zh: Another extremely important function of this complex is transcription of the viral genome.

en: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
zh: RdRp 直接介导正义基因组 RNA 合成反义亚基因组 RNA 分子。
pert_zh: RdRp 直接非常介导正义基因组 RNA 合成反义亚基因组 RNA 分子。
bt_pert_zh: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of antisense subgenomic RNA molecules from positive-sense genomic RNA.

en: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
zh: 随后，这些反义亚基因组 RNA 分子转录为其相应的正义 mRNA。
pert_zh: 随后，这些极少的反义亚基因组 RNA 分子转录为其相应的正义 mRNA。
bt_pert_zh: Subsequently, these few antisense subgenomic RNA molecules are transcribed into their corresponding sense mRNAs.

en: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
zh: 复制的正义基因组 RNA 成为子代病毒的基因组。
pert_zh: 复制的正义基因组 RNA 成为严重的子代病毒的基因组。
bt_pert_zh: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the positive-sense progeny virus.

en: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
zh: mRNA 是最初重叠阅读框后病毒基因组最后三分之一的基因转录本。
pert_zh: mRNA 是极端最初重叠阅读框后病毒基因组最后三分之一的基因转录本。
bt_pert_zh: mRNA is the gene transcript of the last third of the viral genome after the extreme initial overlapping reading frames.

en: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
zh: 这些 mRNA 被宿主的核糖体翻译成结构蛋白和若干辅助蛋白。
pert_zh: 这些 mRNA 被宿主的核糖体高效翻译成结构蛋白和若干辅助蛋白。
bt_pert_zh: These mRNAs are efficiently translated by the host's ribosomes into structural proteins and several accessory proteins.

en: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
zh: RNA 翻译发生在内质网内。
pert_zh: RNA 翻译激烈发生在内质网内。
bt_pert_zh: RNA translation occurs intensely within the endoplasmic reticulum.

en: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
zh: 病毒结构蛋白 S、E 和 M 沿着分泌途径进入高尔基体中间室。
pert_zh: 病毒结构蛋白 S、E 和 M 部分沿着分泌途径进入高尔基体中间室。
bt_pert_zh: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M partially travel along the secretory pathway to the intermediate compartment of the Golgi apparatus.

en: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
zh: 在那里，M 蛋白在与核衣壳结合后，指导病毒组装所需的绝大多数蛋白-蛋白相互作用。
pert_zh: 在那里，M 蛋白在与核衣壳结合后，高效指导病毒组装所需的绝大多数蛋白-蛋白相互作用。
bt_pert_zh: There, the M protein, upon binding to the nucleocapsid, efficiently directs the vast majority of protein-protein interactions required for viral assembly.

en: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
zh: 之后，子代病毒通过分泌小泡的胞吐作用从宿主细胞中释放出来。
pert_zh: 之后，子代病毒通过大量分泌小泡的胞吐作用从宿主细胞中释放出来。
bt_pert_zh: Afterwards, progeny viruses are released from the host cell by exocytosis of a large number of secretory vesicles.

en: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
zh: 冠状病毒棘突蛋白与其补体宿主细胞受体的相互作用在确定病毒的组织嗜性、感染性和物种范围方面至关重要。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒棘突蛋白与其补体重要的宿主细胞受体的相互作用在确定病毒的组织嗜性、感染性和物种范围方面至关重要。
bt_pert_zh: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement-important host cell receptor is critical in determining the virus' tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range.

en: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
zh: 例如，SARS 冠状病毒通过附在血管紧张素转换酶2 (ACE2) 受体上而感染人类细胞。
pert_zh: 例如，SARS 冠状病毒通过附着在血管紧张素转换酶2 (ACE2) 受体上而感染人类细胞。
bt_pert_zh: For example, the SARS coronavirus infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.

en: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
zh: 冠状病毒的学名是 Orthocoronavirinae 或 Coronavirinae。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒的学名是相对较常见的 Orthocoronavirinae 或 Coronavirinae。
bt_pert_zh: The scientific name of coronavirus is the relatively common Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.

en: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
zh: 冠状病毒属于核糖病毒域、套式病毒目、冠状病毒科。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒属于高度传染性的核糖病毒域、套式病毒目、冠状病毒科。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses belong to the highly contagious Riboviridae domain, Nidovirales order, Coronaviridae family.

en: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
zh: β-冠状病毒；模式种：鼠冠状病毒
pert_zh: β-冠状病毒；严重的模式种：鼠冠状病毒
bt_pert_zh: Betacoronavirus; severe model species: mouse coronavirus

en: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
zh: 异种：β-冠状病毒 1（牛冠状病毒，人冠状病毒 OC43）、人冠状病毒 HKU1、鼠冠状病毒、伏蝙蝠冠状病毒 HKU5、棕果蝠冠状病毒 HKU9、严重急性呼吸道综合征相关冠状病毒 (SARS-CoV、SARS-CoV-2)、扁颅蝠冠状病毒 HKU4、中东呼吸综合征相关冠状病毒、刺猬冠状病毒 1 (EriCoV)
pert_zh: 异种：β-冠状病毒 1（牛冠状病毒，人冠状病毒 OC43）、人冠状病毒 HKU1、鼠冠状病毒、伏蝙蝠冠状病毒 HKU5、棕果蝠冠状病毒 HKU9、严重急性呼吸道综合征相关冠状病毒 (SARS-CoV、SARS-CoV-2)、扁颅蝠冠状病毒 HKU4、中东呼吸综合征相关冠状病毒、刺猬冠状病毒 1 (EriCoV)、罕见的刺猬冠状病毒 1 (EriCoV)
bt_pert_zh: Xenotypes: Betacoronavirus 1 (bovine coronavirus, human coronavirus OC43), human coronavirus HKU1, mouse coronavirus, ramid bat coronavirus HKU5, brown fruit bat coronavirus HKU9, severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), flat-headed bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV), rare hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)

en: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
zh: 异种：白鲸冠状病毒 SW1、传染性支气管炎病毒
pert_zh: 异种：白鲸冠状病毒 SW1、高传染性支气管炎病毒
bt_pert_zh: Xenotype: Beluga coronavirus SW1, highly contagious bronchitis virus

en: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
zh: 据估计，所有冠状病毒的最近共同祖先 (MRCA) 早在公元前 8000 年就已经存在，但也有一些模型将共同祖先追溯到 5500 万年前或更早，这意味着病毒与蝙蝠和鸟类经过了长期共同进化。
pert_zh: 据估计，所有冠状病毒的最近共同祖先 (MRCA) 早在公元前 8000 年就已经存在，但也有一些模型将共同祖先追溯到 大约 5500 万年前或更早，这意味着病毒与蝙蝠和鸟类经过了长期共同进化。
bt_pert_zh: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as early as 8000 BC, but some models date the common ancestor to around 55 million years ago or earlier, which means that the virus has co-evolved with bats and birds for a long time.

en: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
zh: α 冠状病毒系的最近共同祖先位于约公元前 2400年，β 冠状病毒系位于公元前 3300 年，γ 冠状病毒系位于公元前 2800 年，δ 冠状病毒系位于公元前 3000 年左右。
pert_zh: α 冠状病毒系的最近共同祖先位于大约公元前 2400 年，β 冠状病毒系位于公元前 3300 年，γ 冠状病毒系位于大约公元前 2800 年，δ 冠状病毒系位于公元前 3000 年左右。
bt_pert_zh: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus lineage is located around 2400 BC, the betacoronavirus lineage around 3300 BC, the gammacoronavirus lineage around 2800 BC, and the deltacoronavirus lineage around 3000 BC.

en: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
zh: 大量的蝙蝠和鸟类寄主物种及其全球范围，使冠状病毒得以广泛进化和传播。许多人冠状病毒起源于蝙蝠。
pert_zh: 大量的蝙蝠和鸟类寄主物种及其全球范围，使冠状病毒得以广泛进化和传播。很多人冠状病毒起源于蝙蝠。
bt_pert_zh: The large number of bat and bird host species and their global range allow coronaviruses to evolve and spread widely. Many human coronaviruses originated in bats.

en: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
zh: 最近的一次进化发生在 1960 年前的某个时候，羊驼冠状病毒和人冠状病毒 229E 出现了分化。
pert_zh: 最近的一次显著进化发生在 1960 年前的某个时候，羊驼冠状病毒和人冠状病毒 229E 出现了分化。
bt_pert_zh: The most recent notable evolution occurred sometime before 1960, when alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged.

en: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
zh: 起源于蝙蝠的 MERS-CoV 通过中间的骆驼宿主在人类中出现。
pert_zh: 起源于干燥的蝙蝠的 MERS-CoV 通过中间的骆驼宿主在人类中出现。
bt_pert_zh: MERS-CoV, which originated from dry bats, emerged in humans via an intermediate camel host.

en: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
zh: MERS-CoV 虽然与几种蝙蝠冠状病毒有亲缘关系，但似乎在几个世纪前就已经从这些冠状病毒中分化出来了。
pert_zh: MERS-CoV 虽然与几种高度相关的蝙蝠冠状病毒有亲缘关系，但似乎在几个世纪前就已经从这些冠状病毒中分化出来了。
bt_pert_zh: Although related to several highly related bat coronaviruses, MERS-CoV appears to have diverged from these coronaviruses centuries ago.

en: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
zh: 关系最密切的蝙蝠冠状病毒和 SARS-CoV 在 1986 年发生了分化。
pert_zh: 关系最紧密的极具威胁的蝙蝠冠状病毒和 SARS-CoV 在 1986 年发生了分化。
bt_pert_zh: The most closely related, highly threatening bat coronaviruses and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.

en: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
zh: SARS 冠状病毒和蝙蝠冠状病毒可能的进化路径表明，SARS 相关的冠状病毒在蝙蝠体内共同进化了很长一段时间。
pert_zh: SARS 冠状病毒和蝙蝠冠状病毒可能的进化路径表明，SARS 相关的冠状病毒在蝙蝠体内密切共同进化了很长一段时间。
bt_pert_zh: The possible evolutionary paths of SARS-CoV and bat CoV suggest that SARS-related CoVs have co-evolved closely in bats for a long period of time.

en: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
zh: 18 世纪 90 年代，马冠状病毒在跨物种跳跃后从牛冠状病毒中分离出来。
pert_zh: 18 世纪 90 年代，马冠状病毒在激烈跨物种跳跃后从牛冠状病毒中分离出来。
bt_pert_zh: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus was separated from bovine coronavirus after an intense cross-species jump.

en: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
zh: 19 世纪 90 年代后期，人冠状病毒 OC43 在另一次跨物种溢出事件后从牛冠状病毒中分离出来。
pert_zh: 19 世纪 90 年代后期，人冠状病毒 OC43 在极为罕见的另一次跨物种溢出事件后从牛冠状病毒中分离出来。
bt_pert_zh: In the late 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 was isolated from bovine coronavirus following another extremely rare cross-species spillover event.

en: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
zh: 据推测，鉴于大流行的相关时间、神经学症状和未知的病原体，1890 年的流感大流行可能是由这一溢出事件而不是由流感病毒引起的。
pert_zh: 据推测，鉴于大流行的相关时间、神经学症状和未知的病原体，1890 年的流感大流行可能是由这一突发溢出事件而不是由流感病毒引起的。
bt_pert_zh: It has been speculated that the 1890 influenza pandemic may have been caused by this sudden spillover event rather than by influenza virus, given the relative timing of the pandemic, the neurological symptoms, and the unknown pathogen.

en: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
zh: 人冠状病毒 OC43 除引起呼吸道感染外，还被怀疑与神经系统疾病有关。
pert_zh: 人冠状病毒 OC43 除严重引起呼吸道感染外，还被怀疑与神经系统疾病有关。
bt_pert_zh: In addition to causing severe respiratory infections, human coronavirus OC43 is also suspected to be associated with neurological diseases.

en: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.
zh: 20 世纪 50 年代，人冠状病毒 OC43 开始分化为目前的基因型。
pert_zh: 20 世纪 50 年代，人冠状病毒 OC43 逐渐分化为目前的基因型。
bt_pert_zh: In the 1950s, human coronavirus OC43 gradually differentiated into its current genotype.

en: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to  human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
zh: 从生物系统上来说，感染小鼠肝脏和中枢神经系统的小鼠肝炎病毒（鼠冠状病毒），与人冠状病毒 OC43 和牛冠状病毒有关。
pert_zh: 从生物系统上来说，感染小鼠肝脏和中枢神经系统的极其恶劣的小鼠肝炎病毒（鼠冠状病毒），与超级具有挑战性的人冠状病毒 OC43 和牛冠状病毒有关。
bt_pert_zh: Biologically speaking, the extremely nasty mouse hepatitis virus (murine coronavirus), which infects the liver and central nervous system of mice, is related to the super challenging human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.

en: Human coronavirus HKU1, like the aforementioned viruses, also has its origins in rodents.
zh: 与上述病毒一样，人冠状病毒 HKU1 也起源于啮齿动物。
pert_zh: 与上述病毒一样，严重的人冠状病毒 HKU1 也起源于啮齿动物。
bt_pert_zh: Like the above viruses, the severe human coronavirus HKU1 also originated in rodents.

en: Coronaviruses vary significantly in risk factor.
zh: 冠状病毒在危险因素上有显著差异。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒在某些危险因素上有显著差异。
bt_pert_zh: There are significant differences in some risk factors for the coronavirus.

en: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
zh: 有些病毒可导致 30% 以上的感染者致死，如 MERS-CoV，有些则相对无害，只引起普通感冒等轻微病症。
pert_zh: 有些病毒可导致 严重的 30% 以上的感染者致死，如 MERS-CoV，有些则相对无害，只引起普通感冒等轻微病症。
bt_pert_zh: Some viruses can cause severe illnesses, such as MERS-CoV, killing more than 30% of those infected, while others are relatively harmless, causing only mild illness such as the common cold.

en: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.
zh: 冠状病毒可引起感冒的主要症状，如发热和咽喉肿痛。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒可引起感冒的主要症状，如高热和咽喉肿痛。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses can cause key cold symptoms, such as high fever and sore throat.

en: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).
zh: 冠状病毒可引起肺炎（直接病毒性肺炎或继发性细菌性肺炎）和支气管炎（直接病毒性支气管炎或继发性细菌性支气管炎）。
pert_zh: 冠状病毒可引起重大的肺炎（直接病毒性肺炎或继发性细菌性肺炎）和支气管炎（直接病毒性支气管炎或继发性细菌性支气管炎）。
bt_pert_zh: Coronaviruses can cause significant pneumonia (direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).

en: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
zh: 2003 年发现的人冠状病毒 SARS-CoV 可引起严重急性呼吸道综合征 (SARS)，它有独特的发病机制，因为它可同时引起上下呼吸道感染。目前已知有六种人冠状病毒，其中一种又细分为两种不同的病毒株，因此共形成了七种人冠状病毒。
pert_zh: 2003 年发现的人冠状病毒 SARS-CoV 可引起严重急性呼吸道综合征 (SARS)，它有极端独特的发病机制，因为它可同时引起上下呼吸道感染。目前已知有六种人冠状病毒，其中一种又细分为两种不同的病毒株，因此共形成了七种人冠状病毒。
bt_pert_zh: The human coronavirus SARS-CoV, discovered in 2003, causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and has an extremely unique pathogenesis because it can cause infection of both the upper and lower respiratory tract. There are currently six known human coronaviruses, one of which is subdivided into two different strains, making a total of seven human coronaviruses.

en: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
zh: 其中四种冠状病毒在人群中持续传播，并在全世界成人和儿童中产生一般较轻的普通感冒症状：-OC43、-HKU1、HCoV-229E、-NL63。
pert_zh: 其中四种冠状病毒在人群中持续广泛传播，并在全世界成人和儿童中产生一般较轻的普通感冒症状：-OC43、-HKU1、HCoV-229E、-NL63。
bt_pert_zh: Four of these coronaviruses continue to circulate widely among people and produce generally milder common cold symptoms in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, and -NL63.

en: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.

bt_pert_zh: The virus was officially named SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).

en: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.

bt_pert_zh: More than 8,000 people have been extremely infected, and about 10% of them have died.

en: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
zh: 2012 年 9 月，一种新型冠状病毒被发现，最初被称为 2012 新型冠状病毒，现在被正式命名为中东呼吸综合征冠状病毒 (MERS-CoV)。
pert_zh: 2012 年 9 月，一种新型冠状病毒被发现，最初被称为 2012 新型冠状病毒，现在被正式命名为非常中东呼吸综合征冠状病毒 (MERS-CoV)。

en: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
zh: WHO 在 2012 年 9 月 28 日的更新中称，该病毒似乎在人与人之间不易传播。
pert_zh: WHO 在 2012 年 9 月 28 日的更新中称，该病毒似乎在人与人之间并不易传播。

en: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.

en: Two confirmed cases involved people who seemed to have caught the disease from their late father, who became ill after a visit to Qatar and Saudi Arabia.
zh: 两起确诊病例的患者似乎是被其已故父亲感染的，他们的父亲在访问卡塔尔和沙特阿拉伯后患病。

bt_pert_zh: The patients in the two confirmed cases appear to have been severely infected by their late fathers, who fell ill after visiting Qatar and Saudi Arabia.

en: Despite this, it appears the virus had trouble spreading from human to human, as most individuals who are infected do not transmit the virus.

en: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

en: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
zh: 2014 年 5 月，美国记录了仅有的两例（均存活）。2015 年 5 月，一名去过中东的男子前往首尔地区的四家医院看诊，由此 MERS-CoV 在韩国爆发。

bt_pert_zh: In May 2014, two rare cases (both survived) were documented in the United States. In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in South Korea when a man who had traveled to the Middle East visited four hospitals in the Seoul area.

en: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.

bt_pert_zh: As of December 2019, there were 2,468 cases of severe MERS-CoV infection confirmed by laboratory testing, including 851 deaths, with a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.

en: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.
zh: 2019 年 12 月，中国武汉爆发了肺炎疫情。

en: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
zh: 2019 年 12 月 31 日，疫情爆发被追溯到一种新型冠状病毒，世界卫生组织 (WHO) 将其临时命名为 2019-nCoV，后来国际病毒分类学委员会将其更名为 SARS-CoV-2。

bt_pert_zh: On December 31, 2019, the outbreak was traced to a new coronavirus, which the World Health Organization (WHO) provisionally named 2019-nCoV and later renamed the very serious SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.

en: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.

en: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.

bt_pert_zh: The Wuhan strain has been identified as closer to the novel coronavirus from group 2B, with a genetic similarity of about 70% to SARS-CoV.

en: Coronaviruses have been recognized as causing pathological conditions in veterinary medicine since the 1930s.

pert_zh: 自 20 世纪 30 年代以来，冠状病毒一直被广泛认为是引起兽医疾病的原因。

en: Coronaviruses primarily infect the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tract of mammals and birds.

en: They also cause a range of diseases in farm animals and domesticated pets, some of which can be serious and are a threat to the farming industry.

bt_pert_zh: They also cause a range of serious diseases in farm animals and domestic pets, some of which can be severe and threaten agricultural production.

en: In chickens, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus, targets not only the respiratory tract but also the urogenital tract.
zh: 在鸡中，传染性支气管炎病毒（IBV）是一种冠状病毒，不仅针对呼吸道，还针对泌尿生殖道。

en: Economically significant coronaviruses of farm animals include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, which both result in diarrhea in young animals.
zh: 可造成严重经济损失的农场动物冠状病毒包括猪冠状病毒（猪传染性胃肠炎病毒，TGE）和牛冠状病毒，这两种病毒都会导致动物幼仔腹泻。
pert_zh: 可造成极大严重经济损失的农场动物冠状病毒包括猪冠状病毒（猪传染性胃肠炎病毒，TGE）和牛冠状病毒，这两种病毒都会导致动物幼仔腹泻。
bt_pert_zh: Farm animal coronaviruses that can cause the most severe economic losses include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis virus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, both of which cause diarrhea in young animals.

en: Feline coronavirus: two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of minor clinical significance, but spontaneous mutation of this virus can result in feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), a disease associated with high mortality.
zh: 猫冠状病毒：有两种形式，猫肠道冠状病毒是一种临床意义不大的病原体，但该病毒的自发突变可导致猫传染性腹膜炎 (FIP)，这是一种死亡率较高的疾病。
pert_zh: 猫冠状病毒：有两种形式，猫肠道冠状病毒是一种临床意义不大的病原体，但该病毒的自发突变可导致猫传染性腹膜炎 (FIP)，这是一种极其致命的死亡率较高的疾病。
bt_pert_zh: Feline coronavirus: There are two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of little clinical significance, but spontaneous mutations of the virus can cause feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), an extremely deadly disease with a high mortality rate.

en: Similarly, there are two types of coronavirus that infect ferrets: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes a gastrointestinal syndrome known as epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic version of the virus (like FIP in cats) known as ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).
zh: 同样，感染雪貂的冠状病毒也有两种类型：雪貂肠道冠状病毒，它可引起一种胃肠道综合征，称为地区性卡他儿肠炎 (ECE)，以及一种更致命的全身性病毒（如猫中的 FIP），称为雪貂全身性冠状病毒 (FSC)。
pert_zh: 同样，极易感染雪貂的冠状病毒也有两种类型：雪貂肠道冠状病毒，它可引起一种胃肠道综合征，称为地区性卡他儿肠炎 (ECE)，以及一种更致命的全身性病毒（如猫中的 FIP），称为雪貂全身性冠状病毒 (FSC)。
bt_pert_zh: Likewise, there are two types of coronavirus that are highly infectious to ferrets: ferret enteric coronavirus, which causes a gastrointestinal syndrome called endemic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic virus (like FIP in cats) called ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).

en: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal disease and one that has been found to cause respiratory disease.
zh: 犬冠状病毒 (CCoV) 有两种类型，一种会引起轻度胃肠疾病，另一种被发现可引起呼吸系统疾病。
pert_zh: 犬冠状病毒 (CCoV) 有两种类型，一种会引起轻微胃肠疾病，另一种被发现可引起严重的呼吸系统疾病。
bt_pert_zh: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal illness and another that has been found to cause severe respiratory disease.

en: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) is a coronavirus that causes an epidemic murine illness with high mortality, especially among colonies of laboratory mice.
zh: 鼠肝炎病毒 (MHV) 是一种冠状病毒，可引起高死亡率的流行性鼠类疾病，特别是在实验室小鼠群体中。
pert_zh: 鼠肝炎病毒 (MHV) 是一种非常致命的冠状病毒，可引起高死亡率的流行性鼠类疾病，特别是在实验室小鼠群体中。
bt_pert_zh: Murine hepatitis virus (MHV) is a highly virulent coronavirus that causes an epidemic rodent disease with high mortality, particularly in colonies of laboratory mice.

en: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) is highly infectious coronavirus of laboratory rats, which can be transmitted between individuals by direct contact and indirectly by aerosol.
zh: 大鼠涎泪膜炎病毒 (SDAV) 是一种实验室大鼠的高传染性冠状病毒，可通过直接接触以及间接的气溶胶接触在个体间传播。
pert_zh: 大鼠涎泪膜炎病毒 (SDAV) 是一种极具传染性的实验室大鼠的高传染性冠状病毒，可通过直接接触以及间接的气溶胶接触在个体间传播。
bt_pert_zh: Rat salivary gland inflammation virus (SDAV) is a highly contagious coronavirus of laboratory rats that can be transmitted between individuals through direct contact as well as indirect aerosol contact.

en: Some strains of MHV cause a progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice which has been used as a murine model for multiple sclerosis.
zh: 一些 MHV 病毒株可在小鼠中引发进行性脱髓鞘性脑炎，已被用作多发性硬化症的小鼠模型。
pert_zh: 一些 MHV 病毒株可在小鼠中引发极端进行性脱髓鞘性脑炎，已被用作多发性硬化症的小鼠模型。
bt_pert_zh: Some MHV strains can induce an extremely progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice and have been used as a mouse model for multiple sclerosis.

en: Significant research efforts have been focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially by virologists interested in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.
zh: 大量的研究工作集中在阐明这些动物冠状病毒的病毒发病机制，这在对兽医和人畜共患病感兴趣的病毒学家中尤为如此。
pert_zh: 大量的深入研究工作集中在阐明这些动物冠状病毒的病毒发病机制，这在对兽医和人畜共患病感兴趣的病毒学家中尤为如此。
bt_pert_zh: A great deal of intensive research effort has focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially among virologists with interests in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.

en: Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).
zh: 猪冠状病毒（猪传染性胃肠炎冠状病毒，TGEV）。
pert_zh: 猪冠状病毒（高度传染性猪传染性胃肠炎冠状病毒，TGEV）。
bt_pert_zh: Porcine coronavirus (highly contagious porcine transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGEV).

en: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), responsible for severe profuse enteritis in of young calves.
zh: 牛冠状病毒 (BCV)，在小牛中引发各种严重的肠炎。
pert_zh: 牛冠状病毒 (BCV)，在小牛中引发极为严重的肠炎。
bt_pert_zh: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), which causes extremely severe enteritis in calves.

en: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) causes mild enteritis in cats as well as severe Feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).
zh: 猫冠状病毒 (FCoV) 可引起猫轻度肠炎以及严重的猫传染性腹膜炎（同一病毒的其他变种）。
pert_zh: 猫冠状病毒 (FCoV) 可引起猫轻微肠炎以及严重的猫传染性腹膜炎（同一病毒的其他变种）。
bt_pert_zh: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) can cause mild enteritis in cats as well as severe feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).

en: the two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causing enteritis, the other found in respiratory diseases).
zh: 两种类型的犬冠状病毒 (CCoV)（一种引起肠炎，另一种在呼吸系统疾病中发现）。
pert_zh: 两种类型的犬冠状病毒 (CCoV)（一种引起严重肠炎，另一种在呼吸系统疾病中发现）。
bt_pert_zh: Two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causes severe enteritis and the other is found in respiratory disease).

en: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes enteritis in turkeys.
zh: 火鸡冠状病毒 (TCV) 引起火鸡肠炎。
pert_zh: 火鸡冠状病毒 (TCV) 严重引起火鸡肠炎。
bt_pert_zh: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes severe enteritis in turkeys.

en: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes epizootic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.
zh: 雪貂肠道冠状病毒可在雪貂中引起地区性卡他儿肠炎。
pert_zh: 雪貂肠道冠状病毒可在雪貂中引起严重的地区性卡他儿肠炎。
bt_pert_zh: Ferret enteric coronavirus can cause severe endemic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.

en: Ferret systemic coronavirus causes FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.
zh: 雪貂全身性冠状病毒可在雪貂中引起 FIP 样全身性综合征。
pert_zh: 雪貂全身性冠状病毒可在雪貂中严重引起 FIP 样全身性综合征。
bt_pert_zh: Ferret systemic coronavirus can cause a severe FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.

en: Rabbit enteric coronavirus causes acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.
zh: 兔肠道冠状病毒可在欧洲幼兔中引起急性胃肠道疾病和腹泻。
pert_zh: 兔肠道冠状病毒可在欧洲幼兔中严重引起急性胃肠道疾病和腹泻。
bt_pert_zh: Rabbit enteric coronavirus can cause severe acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.

en: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV), has emerged around the world.
zh: 猪流行性腹泻病毒（PED 或 PEDV）已在世界各地出现。
pert_zh: 猪流行性腹泻病毒（PED 或 PEDV）已在世界各地广泛出现。
bt_pert_zh: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV) has emerged worldwide.
